data.title: August 26, 1814
data.meta_description: AUGUST 26, 1814IN THIS VILLAGE PRESIDENT MADISONAND MEMBERS OF HIS OFFICIAL FAMILYFOUND REFUGE IN THE HOME OF CALEBBENTLEY, FIRST POSTMASTER OF BROOKEVILLE, FOLLOWING THE BURNINGOF THE CAPITOL AND THE WHITE HOUSEBY THE BRITISH ARMY. MANY OTHERREFUGEES FROM WASHINGTON ALSOFOUND SHELTER HERE.ERECTED AUGUST 22, 1964THE MONTGOMERY COUNTY HISTORICAL SOCIETYTHE MARYLAND HOUSE AND GARDEN TOUR, 1962Submitted by Patrick M. Ryan
